org.springframework.core.log

Class LogMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.core.log.LogMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CharSequence

    public abstract class LogMessage
extends Object
implements CharSequence
    A simple log message type for use with Commons Logging, allowing for convenient lazy resolution of a given Supplier instance (typically bound to a Java 8 lambda expression) or a printf-style format string (String.format(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...)) in its toString().
    Since:
    5.2
    Author:
    Juergen Hoeller
    See Also:
    of(Supplier), format(String, Object), format(String, Object...), Log.fatal(Object), Log.error(Object), Log.warn(Object), Log.info(Object), Log.debug(Object), Log.trace(Object)

      String toString()
      This will be called by the logging provider, potentially once per log target (therefore locally caching the result here).

      • format

        public static LogMessage format(String format,
                                Object... args)
        Build a lazily formatted message from the given format string and varargs.
